content.description: Squat start at the horizontal slot and move up and left to good holds. Get a handjam and reach up and left to a sloper in the crack. Get a heel and pull too reach a pocket up and out right. Stay right and trust a blind toe in the crack    Work some magic and stand up.
content.protection: Atleast 2 pads and a spotter. Tree is right behind the top out.
content.location: Center line on the big boulder uphill while heading towards "Lone Wolf"

climbs.name: Monkey Wins Big at the Slots

content.description: This is a fun traverse starting at the right side of the downhill face. Sit start with a right hand sidepull and a left hand slot. Pull on and stand up to a rail on the lip of the boulder. From here make your way leftwards with a few tricky moves to get past "Slot Machine". From the crack, reach far left to the rail on "Brass Monkey", and with difficulty join that line before continuing around the bulbous corner for a cruxy mantel-like exit on to the slab. From here continue left and up to topout! A fun traverse with some unique movement and lots of moves!
content.protection: 3 pads and a spotter or two.
content.location: This is a right to left traverse on the boulder.

content.description:
A fun climb with big easy moves on big holds leading to a crux mantle on a shelf.  

  Start down low on a jug, follow a big holds up leading to an obvious shelf, and mantle that.
content.protection: Pad and a spotter for the tree.
content.location: This climb is on the giant clam boulder, to the right of Brass Monkey and Slot Machine.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on a good rail. The left hand should be in a crystal pocket. Make a big move out right to another rail. Match or go straight to a crimp up and left. Hit a sloper for the right hand, then get a higher foot and rock over, staying tight and balanced reach out left to small holds and swap feet and move up the slab. Top out with invisible holds and walk it off.
content.protection: Two or three pads and a spotter
content.location: South end of Clough. If heading towards "Tears of a Lone Wolf", this problem will be about 40 yards before it and on the right. The rock looks like an elongated Pacman.

content.description: This is a large boulder whose downhill face resembles an elongated PAC-Man. This boulder has a few good problems on it and most of them use neat slots. The center line following the diagnol crack is named "Slot Machine", while the left bulging arete is known as "Brass Monkey.
